13.a: Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, the prophets, and many from the east, west, north, and south.
13.q: Who will gather to relax at the dinner table in the kingdom of God?

13.a: He must be killed in Jerusalem.
13.q: Where did Jesus say that he must be killed?

13.a: He desired to gather them the way a hen gathers her brood of chicks.
13.q: What did Jesus desire to do with the people of Jerusalem?
How did the people of Jerusalem respond to Jesus' desire for them?

13.a: Their house was abandoned, and they would not see Jesus again until they said, "Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord."
13.q: Therefore, what did Jesus prophesy about Jerusalem and its people?

14.a: Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath, or not?
14.q: With the man suffering from edema standing in front of him, what did Jesus ask the experts in the Jewish law and the Pharisees?
What was the experts' and Pharisees' answer?

14.a: Jesus reminded them that they would help their own son or ox that fell into a well on the Sabbath.
14.q: After healing the man, how did Jesus show that the experts and Pharisees were hypocrites?
What did Jesus say will happen to whoever exalts himself?
What did Jesus say will happen to whoever humbles himself?

14.a: They will be repaid at the resurrection of the just.
14.q: According to Jesus, how will a person be rewarded who invites the poor, crippled, lame, and blind into their home?

14.a: They began to make excuses about why they could not come to the dinner.
14.q: In Jesus' parable of the dinner, what did the people do who were originally invited?

14.a: The poor, crippled, blind, and lame.
14.q: Who did the master then invite to his dinner?

14.a: None of them would taste his dinner.
14.q: What did the master then say about those who were first invited to his dinner?

14.a: They must hate their own family and life, carry their own cross, come after him, and give up all that they have.
14.q: According to Jesus, what must his disciples do?

14.a: The person must count the cost.
14.q: In Jesus' example about what it requires to follow him, what must a person do first who desires to build a tower?
If salt loses its taste, what is done with it?

15.a: He leaves the other ninety-nine and goes and finds the lost sheep, then brings it back, rejoicing.
15.q: In Jesus' parable, what does the shepherd do who loses one of his hundred sheep?

15.a: She diligently searches until she finds it, then rejoices with her friends and neighbors.
15.q: In Jesus' parable, what does the woman do who loses one of her ten silver coins?

15.a: There is joy in the presence of the angels of God.
15.q: What happens in heaven when one sinner repents?

15.a: Give me now the property I am due to inherit.
15.q: In Jesus' parable, what request did the younger son make to his father?

15.a: He wasted the money with wildly extravagant living.
15.q: What did the younger son do with his inheritance?

15.a: He hired himself out to feed another man's pigs.
15.q: After his money was gone, what did the younger son do in order to live?

15.a: He decided to go and confess his sin to his father, and ask to be hired as one of his servants.
15.q: When he began to think clearly, what did the younger son decide to do?

15.a: He ran and hugged and kissed him.
15.q: What did the father do when he saw the younger son coming back home?

15.a: The father gave him a robe, a ring, and sandals, and arranged a feast.
15.q: What did the father quickly do for the younger son?

15.a: He was angry and would not go in to the feast.
15.q: What was the older son's reaction when he was told about the feast for the younger son?

15.a: The older son complained that he had followed his father's rules, but had never been given a goat to have a feast with his friends.
15.q: What was the older son's complaint to his father?

15.a: He said, "Son, you are always with me, and all that is mine is yours."
15.q: What was the father's response to the older son?

15.a: Because the younger son was lost and has now been found.
15.q: Why did the father say it was proper to have a feast for the younger son?

16.a: He heard that the manager was squandering the rich man's possessions.
16.q: What report did the rich man hear about his manager?

16.a: He called for each one of the rich man's debtors and reduced their debt.
16.q: What did the manager do just before he was forced to leave his job?

16.a: He commended the manager because he had acted shrewdly.
16.q: What was the rich man's response to his manager's actions?

16.a: He said, "Make friends for yourselves by means of worldly wealth, so that when it is gone, they may welcome you into the eternal dwellings."
16.q: What did Jesus tell others to do based on this story?

16.a: The person will also be faithful with much.
16.q: Jesus said that a person who is faithful with a little will also be faithful with what else?

16.a: We must choose between God and wealth.
16.q: Which two masters did Jesus say we must choose between to serve?

16.a: The law and the prophets were in effect.
16.q: According to Jesus, what were in effect until John the Baptizer came?

16.a: The gospel of the kingdom of God is now being preached.
16.q: According to Jesus, what is now being preached?
According to Jesus, what kind of person is one who divorces his wife and marries another?

16.a: The beggar Lazarus was carried by angels to Abraham's side.
16.q: In Jesus' story, where did the beggar Lazarus go after he died?
Where did the rich man go after he died?

16.a: He said, "Please have Lazarus come and bring me a little water because I am in anguish in this flame."
16.q: What was the first request that the rich man made to Abraham?

16.a: He said, "There is a great chasm between us that no one can cross."
16.q: What was Abraham's answer to the rich man?

16.a: He said, "Please send Lazarus to warn my brothers about this place."
16.q: What was the second request that the rich man made to Abraham?

16.a: He said, "They have Moses and the prophets; let them listen to them."
16.q: What was Abraham's answer to the rich man?

16.a: They will not be persuaded even if someone rises from the dead.
16.q: Abraham said that if they would not listen to Moses and the prophets, what else would not persuade them?

17.q: What did Jesus say we must do if our brother sins against us and returns saying, "I repent?"

17.a: We should say, "We are unworthy servants; we have only done what we ought to do."
17.q: As servants, what should we say after we have done everything commanded us by our Master?
Who did Jesus meet when entering a village in the borderlands of Samaria and Galilee?

17.a: They said, "Jesus, Master, have mercy on us."
17.q: What did they say to Jesus?

17.a: He told them to go and show themselves to the priests.
17.q: What did Jesus tell them to do?
What happened to the lepers as they went?
How many of the ten lepers returned to thank Jesus?
Where was the leper from who returned to thank Jesus?

17.a: The kingdom of God is within you.
17.q: When asked about the coming of the kingdom, where did Jesus say the kingdom of God is?

17.a: It will be like the lightning flashing from one part of the sky to another.
17.q: What did Jesus say it will be like in his day, when he appears again?

17.a: He must suffer many things and be rejected by that generation.
17.q: What did Jesus say must happen first?

17.a: Many will eat, drink, marry, buy, sell, plant, and build, unaware that the day of destruction has come.
17.q: How will the days of the Son of Man be like the days of Noah and the days of Lot?

17.a: We must not turn back to try to keep our earthly life on that day.
17.q: How must we not be like Lot's wife?

17.a: Where there is a body, there the vultures gather together.
17.q: What picture from nature did Jesus use to answer his disciples' question, "Where, Lord?"

18.a: He wanted to teach them that they should always pray and not become discouraged.
18.q: What did Jesus want to teach is disciples about prayer from this story?

18.a: She asked for justice against her opponent.
18.q: What did the widow keep asking for from the unjust judge?

18.a: He said, "Because this widow causes me trouble and constantly comes to me, I will help her get justice."
18.q: After awhile, what did the unjust judge say to himself?

18.a: He wanted to teach them that God will bring justice to those who cry out to him.
18.q: What did Jesus want to teach his disciples about how God answers prayer?

18.a: A Pharisee and a tax collector went up into the temple to pray.
18.q: In Jesus' story, which two men went up into the temple to pray?

18.a: He thought he was more righteous than other people.
18.q: What was the Pharisee's attitude about his own righteousness and about other people?

18.a: He prayed, "God, be merciful to me, a sinner."
18.q: What was the tax collector's prayer to God in the temple?

18.a: The tax collector was justified before God.
18.q: Which man went back to his house justified before God?

18.a: It belongs to those who are as children.
18.q: Jesus said that the kingdom of God belongs to whom?

18.a: Jesus asked him to sell all that he had and to distribute it to the poor.
18.q: What one thing did Jesus ask the ruler (the one who had obeyed God's commandments from his youth) to do?

18.a: He became extremely sad, for he was very rich.
18.q: How did the ruler respond to Jesus' statement and why?

18.a: Jesus promised them much more in this world, and eternal life in the world to come.
18.q: What did Jesus promise those who have left earthly things for the sake of the kingdom of God?

18.a: That he would be given over to the Gentiles, mocked and shamefully treated, whipped, and killed, but on the third day he would rise again.
18.q: According to Jesus, what had the Old Testament prophets written about the Son of Man?

18.a: He said, "Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me."
18.q: What did the blind man by the road cry out to Jesus?

18.a: They glorified and gave praise to God.
18.q: How did the people respond after seeing the blind man healed?

19.a: He was Zacchaeus, a rich tax collector.
19.q: Who climbed up a tree to see Jesus, and what was his occupation and position in society?

19.a: They said, "Jesus has gone in to visit a man who is a sinner."
19.q: What complaint did everyone make when Jesus went to Zacchaeus' house?

19.a: He said, "Today salvation has come to this house."
19.q: What did Jesus say about Zacchaeus after Zacchaeus announced his gifts to the poor?

19.a: They thought that the kingdom of God would appear immediately.
19.q: What did the people expect would happen when Jesus reached Jerusalem?

19.a: He was going to a far country to receive a kingdom, and then he would return.
19.q: In Jesus' parable, where was the nobleman going to travel?

19.a: He gave them authority over ten cities.
19.q: What did Jesus do for the servant who had been faithful and had made ten more minas?

19.a: He gave them authority over five cities.
19.q: What did Jesus do for the servant who had been faithful and had made five more minas?

19.a: He thought the nobleman was a severe man.
19.q: What kind of man did the wicked servant think the nobleman was?

19.a: He took away the wicked servant's mina.
19.q: What did the nobleman do with the wicked servant?

19.a: The nobleman had them killed before him.
19.q: What did the nobleman do with those who didn't want him to reign over them?

19.a: A colt that had never been ridden.
19.q: What kind of animal did Jesus ride on as he went into Jerusalem?

19.a: They said, "Blessed is the King who comes in the name of the Lord!"
19.q: What did the crowd cry out as Jesus descended the Mount of Olives?

19.a: He said that the stones would cry out.
19.q: What did Jesus say would happen if the people did not cry out rejoicing?
What did Jesus do as he drew near to the city?

19.a: He said that the people would be struck down and that not one stone would be left upon another.
19.q: What did Jesus then prophesy would happen to the people and the city?

19.a: The chief priests and the scribes and the leaders of the people wanted to kill Jesus.
19.q: Who wanted to kill Jesus as he was teaching in the temple?

19.a: Because the people were listening to him intently.
19.q: Why could they not kill him at this time?

20.a: He asked, "Was the baptism of John from heaven or from men?"
20.q: When the Jewish leaders asked Jesus by what authority he taught, what question did Jesus ask them?

20.a: The Jewish leaders thought that Jesus would say, "Then why did you not believe him?"
20.q: If they answered, "from heaven," what did the Jewish leaders think that Jesus would say to them?

20.a: They thought that the people would stone them.
20.q: If they answered, "from men," what did they think that the people would do to them?

20.a: They beat the servants, treated them shamefully, and sent them away empty-handed.
20.q: In Jesus' parable, what did the vine dressers do when the lord sent his servants to get the fruit of the vineyard?
Finally, who did the lord send to the vine dressers?

20.a: They threw him out of the vineyard and killed him.
20.q: What did the vine dressers do when the son came to the vineyard?

20.a: He will destroy those vine dressers and give the vineyard to others.
20.q: What will the lord of the vineyard do to those vine dressers?

20.a: He told this parable against the scribes and the chief priests.
20.q: Who did Jesus tell this parable against?

20.a: He said to give to Caesar the things that are Caesar's, and to God the things that are God's.
20.q: How did Jesus answer the question about whether or not it was lawful to pay taxes to Caesar?

20.a: They did not believe in the resurrection of the dead.
20.q: What event did the Sadducees not believe in?

20.a: In this world there is marriage, but there is not marriage in eternity.
20.q: What did Jesus say about marriage in this world and in eternity?

20.a: He recalled the story of Moses and the bush, in which Moses calls the Lord the God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob.
20.q: What Old Testament story did Jesus recall to prove the truth of the resurrection?

20.a: He quoted, "The Lord said to my Lord, sit at my right hand, until I make your enemies your footstool."
20.q: Which statement of David from the Psalms did Jesus quote in his question to the scribes?

20.a: They were devouring widows' houses, and pretentiously making long prayers.
20.q: Behind their outwardly righteous actions, what wicked things were the scribes doing?

20.a: They will receive a greater condemnation.
20.q: How did Jesus say these scribes would be judged?

21.a: Because she gave out of her poverty and the others gave out of their abundance.
21.q: Why did Jesus say that the poor widow put more into the treasury than all of the others?

21.a: He said that it would be torn down and not one stone would be left on another.
21.q: What did Jesus say would happen to the temple in Jerusalem?

21.a: They asked, "When will these things happen, and what will be the sign that they are about to happen?"
21.q: What two questions did the people ask Jesus about the temple?

21.a: They will say, "I am he," and "The time is near."
21.q: Jesus warned that many deceivers will come. What will these deceivers say?

21.a: There will be wars, earthquakes, famines, plagues, and great signs from heaven.
21.q: What terrible events did Jesus say would happen before the end?

21.a: It will create an opportunity for their testimony.
21.q: What opportunity will the persecution of believers create?

21.a: Parents, brothers, relatives, friends, and "everyone" will hate them.
When Jerusalem is surrounded by armies, its destruction is near.
21.q: What event would indicate that Jerusalem's destruction was near?

21.a: He told them to flee to the mountains, to leave the city, and to not enter the city.
21.q: What did Jesus tell people to do who saw that the destruction of Jerusalem was near?

21.a: He called them the days of vengeance, fulfilling all the things written.
21.q: What did Jesus call the days of the destruction of Jerusalem?

21.a: Jerusalem will be trampled by the Gentiles until the times of the Gentiles are fulfilled.
21.q: How long will Jerusalem be trampled by the Gentiles?

21.a: He said there would be signs in the sun, moon, and stars, and distress of the nations on the earth.
21.q: What signs did Jesus say would precede his coming with power and great glory?

21.a: He referred to the fig tree - when it sprouts buds they knew that summer was near.
21.q: What example did Jesus give of how his listeners knew when a season had come?

21.a: Heaven and earth will pass away.
21.q: What did Jesus say will pass away?

21.a: Jesus' words will never pass away.
He warned them to not let their hearts become burdened with debauchery, drunkenness, and the worries of life.
21.q: What did Jesus warn his listeners _not_ to do since that day will come suddenly?

21.a: He warned them to be alert and praying.
21.q: What did Jesus warn his listeners to do since that day will come suddenly?

22.a: The feast of unleavened bread, called the Passover.
22.q: At this time, which Jewish feast was drawing near?

22.a: He was looking for an opportunity when Jesus was away from the crowd.
22.q: In what circumstances was Judas looking for an opportunity to deliver Jesus to the chief priests?

22.a: They ate it in a guest room in Jerusalem.
22.q: Where did Jesus and the disciples eat the Passover meal?

22.a: He would eat the Passover meal again when it is fulfilled in the kingdom of God.
22.q: When did Jesus say he would eat the Passover meal again?

22.a: He said, "This is my body which is given for you. Do this in remembrance of me."
22.q: What did Jesus say when he broke the bread and gave it to the disciples?

22.a: He said, "This cup is the new covenant in my blood, which is poured out for you."
22.q: What did Jesus say when he gave the cup to the disciples?

22.a: No.
22.q: Did the disciples know who was about to betray Jesus?

22.a: Yes.
22.q: Was it God's plan that Jesus be betrayed?

22.a: The greatest is the one who serves.
22.q: Who did Jesus say was the greatest among his disciples?

22.a: He lived as one who serves.
22.q: How did Jesus live among his disciples?

22.a: He said they would sit on thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
22.q: Where did Jesus promise his disciples they would sit?

22.a: He said that Peter would deny that he knows Jesus three times before the rooster crowed.
22.q: What did Jesus predict that Peter would do?

22.a: The prediction in scripture says, "And he was considered as one of the lawless."
22.q: What written prediction about Jesus was being fulfilled in these events?

22.a: He wanted them to pray that they would not enter into temptation.
22.q: On the Mount of Olives, for what did Jesus tell his disciples to pray?

22.a: He prayed, "Father, if you are willing, remove this cup from me. Nevertheless not my will, but yours be done."
22.q: On the Mount of Olives, what did Jesus pray?

22.a: They were sleeping.
22.q: What were the disciples doing when Jesus returned from praying?

22.a: He betrayed Jesus with a kiss.
22.q: How did Judas betray Jesus in front of the crowd?

22.a: He touched his ear, and healed him.
22.q: What did Jesus do with the man whose ear was cut off?

22.a: He was in the temple.
22.q: Where did Jesus say he was daily with the chief priests?

22.a: The took him to the high priest's house.
22.q: After seizing him, where did they take Jesus?

22.a: He said, "Woman, I do not know him."
22.q: What did Peter say when a certain maid said that Peter had been with Jesus?

22.a: A rooster crowed.
22.q: What happened immediately after Peter denied knowing Jesus for the third time?

22.a: He went outside and wept bitterly.
22.q: What did Peter do after Jesus looked at him?

22.a: They mocked and beat him, and blasphemed him.
22.q: What did the men guarding Jesus do to him?

22.a: They would not believe.
22.q: When the council demanded that Jesus tell them if he is the Christ, Jesus said that if he told them, they would not do what?

22.a: Because they had heard it from Jesus' own mouth.
22.q: Why did the council say that they did not need witnesses to prove that Jesus claimed to be the Christ?

23.a: They said that Jesus was perverting the nation, forbidding tribute to Caesar, and saying that he was the Christ, a king.
23.q: What accusations against Jesus did the Jewish leaders make to Pilate?

23.a: He said, "I find no fault in this man."
23.q: After questioning Jesus, what did Pilate say about him?

23.a: Herod wanted to see Jesus do a miracle.
23.q: Why did Herod want to see Jesus?

23.a: He answered him nothing.
23.q: How did Jesus answer Herod's questions?

23.a: He said, "I find no fault in this man."
23.q: When Jesus was returned to Pilate, what did Pilate say about Jesus to the crowd?

23.a: They wanted Barabbas, a criminal.
23.q: Who did the crowd want released from prison for the Passover feast?

23.a: They shouted, "Crucify him, crucify him."
23.q: What did the crowd shout should be done to Jesus?

23.a: Pilate said, "I have found nothing deserving the death penalty in him."
23.q: For the third time, what did Pilate tell the crowd about Jesus?

23.a: Because they were insistent with loud voices.
23.q: Why did Pilate finally grant the crowd's demand to crucify Jesus?

23.a: Simon of Cyrene carried Jesus' cross.
23.q: Who carried Jesus' cross, and followed behind Jesus?

23.a: They should weep for themselves and their children.
23.q: Who did Jesus say the women of Jerusalem should weep for instead of him?

23.a: Two criminals were crucified with Jesus.
23.q: Who was crucified with Jesus?

23.a: He prayed, "Father, forgive them, for they do not know what they are doing."
23.q: From the cross, what did Jesus pray for those crucifying him?

23.a: They challenged him to save himself.
23.q: The people, the soldiers, and one of the criminals all challenged Jesus to do what, since Jesus claimed to be the Christ?

23.a: It said, "THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS."
23.q: What was written on a sign over Jesus?

23.a: He said, "Remember me when you come into your kingdom."
23.q: What request did the second criminal make to Jesus?

23.a: He said, "Today you will be with me in paradise."
23.q: What promise did Jesus make to the second criminal?

23.a: Darkness came over the land and the curtain of the temple was split down the middle.
23.q: What miraculous events occurred immediately before Jesus' death?

23.a: He said, "Surely this was a righteous man."
23.q: What did the centurion say about Jesus after Jesus' death?

23.a: He asked Pilate for the body and laid it in a tomb.
23.q: What did Joseph of Arimathea do after Jesus' death?

23.a: The Sabbath Day was about to begin.
23.q: What day was about to begin when Jesus was buried?

23.a: They rested, according to God's commandment.
23.q: What did the women who had been with Jesus do on the Sabbath?

24.a: They came very early on the first day of the week.
24.q: When did the women come to the tomb of Jesus?

24.a: They found that the stone had been rolled away and that the body of Jesus was not there.
24.q: What did the women find at the tomb?

24.a: They said that Jesus had risen.
24.q: What did the two men in dazzling apparel (angels) say had happened to Jesus?

24.a: They dismissed the report as idle talk.
24.q: What was the apostles' reaction when the women told of their experience at the tomb?

24.a: He saw the linen cloths by themselves.
24.q: What did Peter see when he looked in the tomb?

24.a: Their eyes were restrained from recognizing him.

24.a: They were hoping that he would free Israel from their enemies.

24.a: They recognized him when he blessed the bread, broke it, and gave it to them.
24.q: When did the two men finally recognize Jesus?

24.a: He vanished out of their sight.
24.q: What did Jesus do when they recognized him?
What did Jesus say first when he appeared to the disciples in Jerusalem?

24.a: He invited the disciples to handle him, and he showed them his hands and feet.
24.q: How did Jesus prove that he was not just a spirit?

24.a: Jesus opened their minds that they might understand.
24.q: How were the disciples then able to understand the scriptures?

24.a: Repentance and forgiveness of sins should be preached to all the nations.
24.q: What did Jesus say should be preached to all the nations?

24.a: He told them to wait until they are clothed with power from on high.
24.q: For what did Jesus tell the disciples to wait?

24.a: He was carried up into heaven.
24.q: What happened to Jesus as he blessed the disciples near Bethany?

24.a: They were continually in the temple, blessing God.
24.q: Where did the disciples then spend their time, and what did they do?
